intro: Geissorhiza brehmii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution along the coastline. Geissorhiza brehmii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
